subject: Climate & Environment
title: The Bald Eagle's Comeback
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Bald Eagle's Comeback.

hook.text: By 1963, only 417 breeding pairs of bald eagles remained in the lower 48 US states.

buildup.text: DDT pesticide thinned their eggshells so badly that eggs broke during incubation.

discovery.text: The US banned DDT in 1972 and listed eagles under the Endangered Species Act.

twist.text: Captive breeding programs and habitat protection slowly rebuilt the population.

climax.text: By 2020, over 71,000 breeding pairs were counted. The eagle was removed from the endangered list.

punchline.text: A nation's symbol was saved by the laws that nation wrote.

quiz.question: What caused the bald eagle population to crash?
